RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 16000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TWO ROOM SCHOOL broke clear while tapering in and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn about the three path, drifted leaving the turn but dueled clear in later yards. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE pressured the pace inside and raced at nearly even terms nearest the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement and just lasted for second. BOBBYS CASE LOAD gave chase toward mid track, rounded the turn about the four path, finished well and just missed second. ALLEGHENY HERO chased the pace, raced in the five path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. BOO TOO ducked in and made contact with Irish fire leaving the gate, took a brief early lead then pressured the winner nearing the five sixteenths pole, but dropped back off the rail midway on the turn and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. FRANK THE BULL chased the pace, raced in the four path of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. CHARTERED COURSE gave chase through the backstretch, raced two deep on the turn and finished evenly. IRISH FIRE came away a step slow and was bumped leaving the gate, picked up the chase inside, rounded the turn near the rail and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Juba's Yankee One
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,rail turn,dug in lane,just lasted 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Bobbys Case Load
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased mid track,4p turn,finished well,just missed 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Two Room School
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke clear,set pressured pace,3p turn,drifted,cleared late yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Whe re Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SO COURAGEOUS pressured the pace and raced at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn, dug in for the lead in later yards and inched further ahead nearing the wire. PRIMETIME JET took over on the chute and set a pressured pace, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement but was met in later yards and relented approaching the wire. THE ILLUSIONIST chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail, drifted into the stretch and ran evenly through the lane. DOC ELM made contact with Super Khozan leaving the gate then pressured the early pace, stayed in range in the four path of the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. BALI'S SHADE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path, left the turn outside and showed little in the lane. SPEIGHTS YOUR MIND chased, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little further. SUPER KHOZAN stumbled and was bumped leaving the gate, chased the early pace outside then saved some ground on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: The Illusionist
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: So Courageous
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close 2d turn,up later yards,inched ahead

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Ollie L. Figgins III & Carisa Figgins

ENTRY.NAME: Primetime Jet
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge rail turn,met later yards,relented

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LORD OF CORK chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn three wide, dug in for the lead late yards and raced clear under the wire. COLT ROCK took the lead at the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, dug in leaving the turn but relented late yards. IN HIGH GEAR chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail, was eased out leaving the turn and finished well to take third the final strides. AREYOUGONNAKISSME chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail but raced hemmed in most of the stretch and was nipped from third at the wire. IN THE LIMELIGHT pressured the pace, raced close in the two and three paths of the turn and ran evenly in the lane. STROLLINGINTHEWIND chased outside, rounded the turn in the four path and ran evenly in the lane. DONNIE B steadied on the chute, gave chase through the backstretch but flattened off the rail on the turn. ROCKING TO HOME saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Areyougonnakissme
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,rail turn,hemmed in most of lane,nipped 3rd wire

ENTRY.NAME: Lord of Cork
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,3wd turn,up late yards,clear under wire

ENTRY.NAME: Colt Rock
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,dug in lane,relented late yards

ENTRY.NAME: In High Gear
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,eased out 1/8,finished well,up 3rd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE SEPTEMBER 10, 2022. Weight, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since September 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Con sidered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: PROTA took over quickly and rated a short lead inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and held well under steady stretch handling. SHOULDA HAD IT raced well off the early pace toward the inside, eased out with a bid into the backstretch and improved in the five path of the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and got up for second late yards. HAPPY CHAMP stalked off the rail, challenged the winner nearing the three eighths pole and raced close off the rail on the far turn, then flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. RIDICULOUS tapered in and stalked the early pace from the three path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in range in the four path and ran evenly in the stretch. SOUTHERN SAVIOUR stalked inside, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the far turn, though, flattened the final sixteenth. JUNGLE WARRIOR settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. TOP HAT TREASON raced inside and showed little response through the backstretch. NOVA BOY raced well off the pace in the three and four paths, left the first turn outside and showed little response. CAYENNE CREEK rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the five path of the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Prota
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured 3/8,rail far turn,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Shoulda Had It
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,eased out,bid 1/2,5p far turn,up 2nd late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Champ
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Ridiculous
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 10 Allowed 4 lbs. (Ra ces Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: XANTHE settled off the pace two deep on the opening turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole and took the lead three wide approaching the eighth pole, dueled clear nearing mid-stretch and was kept alert the final sixteenth. YOLO CHARLOTTE rated close inside, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and cleared second later yards. CHROMATIC LASS became fractious in the gate and moved to the inside to rate the pace, came under pressure at the seven sixteenths pole, was met passing the quarter, raced at the rail through the far turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. TIMETOGETUP stalked three wide, challenged at the three eighths pole, dueled at even terms while between horses on the far turn, then flattened stride leaving the eighth pole. EX RATED settled back inside on the first turn, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and showed little in the lane. SARAH'S WARRIOR saved ground off the pace, gave chase from the seven seven sixteenths pole but weakened in the three path of the far turn. PEARLY GHOST stalked the early pace two deep, challenged toward the three eighths pole but dropped back at the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Sarah's Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

ENTRY.NAME: Yolo Charlotte
ENTRY.COMMENT: rate close inside,chased 7/16,3p far turn,cleared 2nd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Ex Rated
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled inside,chased 7/16,4p far turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Pearly Ghost
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 23000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since February 10 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THEWITCHISGONE rated close off the rail, bid nearing the three eighths pole, took the lead two deep past the five sixteenths and was steadily handled to late stretch. SEATTLE SAILAWAY saved ground on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and dueled through the stretch for second. SPIRIT OF WINDSOR settled off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. JUBA BOUND rounded the opening turn in the six path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the five path of the far turn then flattened the final sixteenth. WELL EQUIPPED raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail, eased outward toward the head of the lane and passed rivals. BEAR'S ESTATE rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was caught passing the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn at the rail and weakened in the lane. MODERN DAY ROMANCE saved early ground, gave chase from the three eighths pole, was forced out toward the head of the lane and showed little further. LEG UP rounded the opening turn off the rail and showed little response through the backstretch. DEVIL'S CANYON raced in the four path the first turn and showed little response. SIENTE EL AMOR showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Leg Up
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Thewitchisgone
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close off rail,bid 3/8,up 2d past 5/16,steady handling lane

ENTRY.NAME: Well Equipped
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased 3/8,off rail far turn,eased out 1/8,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Bear's Estate
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Rayan and Knoblauch Michelle R

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Maiden Special Weight Purse 32700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BORN TO SIN pressured the pace then showed the way from the three eighths pole, raced close at the rail on the turn, dug in to recover the advantage past the eighth pole and dueled clear later yards. EL PACHO raced with a contentious pace three wide, kept the edge through the turn and dueled at even terms in the upper stretch before relenting the final sixteenth. COURT TUDOR gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then dueled through later yards for third. DR RENDEZVOUS chased the pace, rounded the turn about the three path and was outfinished in a later duel for third. MAKIN' GOLD bore in on the chute and raced with the pace, contested between horses on the turn then flattened leaving the eighth pole. O'RIGSBY gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. ONE CANDY CASTLE was shuffled back on the chute, gave chase outside and rounded the turn about the five path. J. WICK became a bit anxious in the gate and gave chase, but never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Court Tudor
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,off rail turn,dueled later yards for 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Born to Sin
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed,led from 3/8,close rail turn,up past 1/8,clear late

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Judith A. Grams & Timothy C. Grams

ENTRY.NAME: J. Wick
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: One Candy Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back chute,chased outside,5p turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Makin' Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: bore in chute,with pace between,close turn,flattened lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 29700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race Since February 10 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 10 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORM BOARDER (CHI) took the lead at the rail at the half mile pole and rated a clear pace, was urged away from the quarter pole, rounded the turn at the rail and was steadily handled in the lane. CAPE LOOKOUT gave distant early chase and improved at the rail on the turn, dug in through the lane, came between horses late and dueled for second. FATHER WALSH ducked out leaving the gate then gave chase, raced off the rail on the turn and was outfinished for second the final yards. FREEDOM IS RINGING chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened stride inside the sixteenth pole. SETTLEMENT DATE chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn, angled to the five path leaving the turn and flattened in the lane. STRETCH THE TRUTH had a brief early lead then gave chase outside, raced in the seven path of the turn and showed little in the lane. COWBOY AT HEART chased through the backstretch but steadied behind a narrowing opening between horses in the vicinity of the five sixteenths pole, rounded the turn in the three path and showed little more. QUALIFLY broke a step slow, was slow into stride and saved ground. Loaded Sniper became fractious in the gate and was a late scratch.

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Boarder (CHI)
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated clear,urged away rail turn,steadily handled lane

ENTRY.NAME: Cape Lookout
ENTRY.COMMENT: distant early chase,improved rail turn,between late,dueled 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 9 7F Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligib ility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EXTRA CRUNCHY tapered in and raced with the pace through the front stretch, took the lead two deep at the nine sixteenths pole and rated from that point, drew away at the rail on the far turn and was steadily handled in the lane. SHESAHUMBLEHUSTLER saved ground off the pace, bid past the seven sixteenths pole and improved at the rail on the far turn, dug in leaving the turn and took second inside the sixteenth pole. BOCA BIRDIE raced well back off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the five path, left the turn outside and finished well to take third while gaining on second. PRETTY SPECTACULAR was hustled along with the early pace, was met at the nine sixteenths pole, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths, raced near the rail on the far turn and flattened the final sixteenth. CEDARS BULLS EYE raced in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path and showed little more. LOVE TO ZOOM raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase into the backstretch but flattened in the three path of the far turn. MOONLIGHT MISS saved ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail nearing the head of the lane. STACIAS RUBY came away awkwardly then closed to contention and stalked three wide the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded through the far turn. BONNIE BLUETOOTH raced off the pace in the three path the first turn, faded through the backstretch and was eased the final quarter mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Shesahumblehustler
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid past 7/16,improved rail turn,up 2nd inside 1/16

ENTRY.NAME: Boca Birdie
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back,bid 3/8,5p far turn,finished well 3rd,gaining on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Stacias Ruby
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,up to contend 3wd,chased 3/8,faded far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Extra Crunchy
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,up past 9/16,drew off far turn,steady handling lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Mr. & Mrs. R. A Brooks Jr.
